sub_topic: Determining the length of a diagonal in a rectangular prism.
message_1: Find the length of the diagonal of a rectangular prism with dimensions 8 cm x 10 cm x 15 cm.
message_2:
To find the length of the diagonal of a rectangular prism, we can use the 3D Pythagorean theorem. If the dimensions of the prism are length (l), width (w), and height (h), the formula for the diagonal (d) is:

d = √(l² + w² + h²)

In this case, the dimensions are 8 cm x 10 cm x 15 cm, so we have:

d = √(8² + 10² + 15²)
d = √(64 + 100 + 225)
d = √(389)

The length of the diagonal is approximately 19.72 cm.
